{
    "number": 225065,
    "data": "2,20,53,54,81,90,101,116,127,146,177,258,287,314,321,353,407,416,438,474,580,639,686,690,797,863,913,922,981,1045,1079,1219,1235,1259,1418,1493,1496,1552,1637,1783,1866,2011,2058,2063,2158,2298,2333,2422,2529",
    "name": "Numbers of the form n^2 plus the sum of squared digits of n^2.",
    "comment": [
        "Note that consecutive terms are not necessarily generated by consecutive values of n.",
        "It appears that 146 is the only term that can be generated by two values of n (7 and 9). There are no other duplicates in the first 10000 terms."
    ],
    "link": [
        "Christian N. K. Anderson, <a href=\"/A225065/b225065.txt\">Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000</a>"
    ],
    "example": [
        "For n=11: 11^2=121; 121 + 1^2 + 2^2 + 1^2 = 127."
    ],
    "program": [
        "(R) sort(unique((1:101)^2+sapply((1:101)^2,function(x) sum(as.numeric(unlist(strsplit(as.character(x),split=\"\")))^2))))"
    ],
    "xref": [
        "Cf. A176995, A062028, A209303."
    ],
    "keyword": "nonn,base",
    "offset": "1,1",
    "author": "_Kevin L. Schwartz_ and _Christian N. K. Anderson_, Apr 26 2013",
    "references": 1,
    "revision": 14,
    "time": "2013-04-30T12:40:42-04:00",
    "created": "2013-04-30T12:40:42-04:00"
